moves.1. e4:
Maybe the best move in the opening.I am not sure.
However the most played one.And the Philidor Defence that i couldnt understand its purpose start.
moves.1... e5: A symetrical answer to share center fairly.
moves.2. Nf3: Develops the knight and attacks the pawn.
moves.2... d6: Saves the pawn but no development. I think Nc6 is better.(Nf6 is good,too)
moves.3. Bc4: Develops the bishop and controls the diogonal.
moves.3... f5: f5?! He thinks i will capture the pawn and have a free space for bishop but i won't.
moves.4. d3: Saves e5 pawn and lets queen's bishop a free diogonal.
moves.5... Bg4: Pins my knight so i cannot play it.And the bishop comes to a good square.
moves.6. Nc3: Now, a small trap -that remember how piece development is important at the opening- starts.
moves.6... h6: Not a good move.He tries not to let me attack his queen by Bg5 but he loses tempo and forgets development.
moves.7. Nxe5: Capture Queen or knight? Which one seems logical?
moves.7... Bxd1: Yeah.He couldnt see the danger and captured my queen.
moves.8. Bf7+: King has only one square to go.
moves.9. Nd5#: A nice mate with coordination of knights and bishop.
